definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

sentences.english: He charged me to take good care of his children while he was away.
sentences.chinese: 他外出时托付我好生照顾他的孩子。

sentences.english: Then she left the cow to the care of a hundred eyed monster, Argus.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉便将牛犊托付给百眼魔鬼阿刚斯看管。

sentences.english: For example, if Ican write and speak fairly well, those are talents entrusted tome.
sentences.chinese: 比如，如果我能说会写，这就是托付给我的财富。

sentences.english: In road politics appoint unfortunate sacrifice, mortal before entrust Qiu Yongnian finishes the job.
sentences.chinese: 途中政委不幸牺牲，临终前托付邱永年完成任务。

sentences.english: She recommended her baby to the care of an old woman.
sentences.chinese: 她把婴儿托付给一位老太婆照管。
她们把他托付给了上帝。

sentences.english: Like Wang Tingting, Guangyao lives at Wang Zhi's foster centre.
sentences.chinese: 和王婷婷一样，光耀也托付给了王志的托管中心。

sentences.english: When unable to call back if they should be entrusted to another agency.
sentences.chinese: 如果自己确实无法亲自回电，应托付他人代办。

sentences.english: We give her the charge of the house while we are away.
sentences.chinese: 我们外出时，托付她管理家务。

sentences.english: We'll leave this entirely to you, so do as you see fit.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这件事全托付给你，你看着办吧。

sentences.english: Now, he is trying to persuade investors to trust him with more.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他正试图说服投资者将更多身家托付给他。

sentences.english: My allergist then entrusts this information to the ambulance attendant.
sentences.chinese: 然后他把这些信息托付给了救护车的随车人员。

sentences.english: Who would be there for your kids?
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子们将托付给谁呢？

sentences.english: She left her baby with a baby-sitter.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己的婴儿托付给了临时保姆。

sentences.english: Guard the good deposit through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us.
sentences.chinese: 你要借着那住在我们里面的圣灵，保守那美好的托付。

sentences.english: Jesus entrusted the spread of this good news to all who believed in him.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣将传播福音这个大任托付了所有信徒。

definition: to entrust a task to sb else
to give oneself wholly to/to put oneself at sb's service/(of a woman) to give one's body to/to marry
to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
approaching one's end/with one foot in the grave
to trust/to have confidence in/to have faith in/to rely on
a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
